qas.question: What is the name of the urban runoff facility?
How many gallons of water does (SMURFF) treat every week?
Santa Monica plans on water independence by what year?
How much money do residents get back for participating in water conservation per square foot?
If (SMURFF) did not collect water where would it go?
How much does SMURFF charge per gallon for its gray water?
How much rainwater falls in Santa Monica each week?
How much water is used by water intensive lawns each week?
What's the establishment year for the Sustainable Water Master Plan?
How much water a week is used by local drought-tolerant gardens?

context: An urban runoff facility <a0_0>(SMURFF)<a0_0/>, the first of its kind in the US, catches and treats <a1_0><b6_0><b7_0><b9_0>3.5 million<a1_0/> US gallons<b9_0/><b7_0/><b6_0/> (13,000 m3) of water each week that would otherwise flow <a4_0>into the bay<a4_0/> via storm-drains and sells it back to end-users within the city for reuse as gray-water, while bio-swales throughout the city allow rainwater to percolate into and replenish the groundwater supply. The groundwater supply in turn plays an important role in the city's Sustainable Water Master Plan, whereby Santa Monica has set a goal of attaining 100% water independence by <a2_0><b8_0>2020<b8_0/><a2_0/>. The city has numerous programs designed to promote water conservation among residents, including a rebate of <a3_0><b5_0>$1.50<b5_0/><a3_0/> per square foot for those who convert water intensive lawns to more local drought-tolerant gardens that require less water.
